ISSUE.TITLE: podman logs: error resolving symbol "sd_journal_xxx": libsystemd-journal.so.0: cannot open shared object file: ENOENT
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Two in the last week and a half. ~~Both under vfs, which may be coincidence but I think it isn't~~ Never mind, it's not a vfs thing: ``` <+073ms> # # podman logs 68fee835c41fcfbab5a673ec3457204394563e38857e979747d8ca457ef72608 <+086ms> # Error: error resolving symbol "sd_journal_open": libsystemd-journal.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory ``` and: ``` # podman-remote [options] logs testPod-init-test time="2023-11-02T06:49:37-05:00" level=error msg="Failed to get journal entry: failed to move journal cursor to next entry: error resolving symbol \"sd_journal_next\": libsystemd-journal.so.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory" ``` Reminiscent of #17042, but different enough to merit its own issue. Also reminiscent of #20282. * fedora-37 : sys podman fedora-37 rootless host boltdb * PR #19959 * [09-13-2023 10:39](https://api.cirrus-ci.com/v1/artifact/task/5521643167023104/html/sys-podman-fedora-37-rootless-host-boltdb.log.html#t--00360) in [sys] podman-kube@.service template * fedora-38 : int remote fedora-38 root host sqlite [remote] * [11-02 08:02](https://api.cirrus-ci.com/v1/artifact/task/6289288019574784/html/int-remote-fedora-38-root-host-sqlite.log.html#t--Podman-kube-play-test-with-init-containers-and-annotation-set--1) in Podman kube play test with init containers and annotation set * fedora-38 : sys podman fedora-38 root host sqlite * [10-23 17:06](https://api.cirrus-ci.com/v1/artifact/task/6023143257538560/html/sys-podman-fedora-38-root-host-sqlite.log.html#t--00478) in [sys] podman networking: port with --userns=keep-id for rootless or --uidmap=* for rootful Seen in: int+sys podman+remote fedora-37+fedora-38 root+rootless host sqlite

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #20568 from giuseppe/update-c-common vendor: update containers/common

COMMIT.MESSAGE: vendor: update github.com/coreos/go-systemd/v22 to latest main This fixes a CI flake. go-systemd was not handling the dlerror() function correctly which lead to wrong errors being reported. [NO NEW TESTS NEEDED] Fixes #20569 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>
